Html:
Hello,

I am wondering what the status is of styling/formatting Chart Titles and Axis Labels?

When trying to load & save an example .xlsx which contains styling (font size, font, color, background..) of the Title of a Chart it is being completely ignored in the saved file, leading me to assume this is not implemented at all yet in PHPExcel?

Looking at least in _writeTitle of PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007_Chart I see that the Title is being written as a PHPExcel_RichText, but still if I try to modify the text color of the PHPExcel_RichText I'm setting as the title of my Chart, the default (black) is still being used in the generated .xlsx

Am I trying to do something which is not supported yet, or am I doing something wrong?

If not supported yet I would be happy to help to add this functionality, as we're relying heavily on PHPExcel at my company. I would need some pointers though to get me started, since I'm still fairly new to PHPExcel.

Best regards,
Simon

I managed to fix these for myself in the 1.7.9 release of PHPExcel.

The changes are available here in case it would help anyone else having the same problem:

https://github.com/simonfi/PHPExcel/commit/eab9a9cc78284d929dfa6c1bc71f9e4e4a0c10f1

https://github.com/simonfi/PHPExcel/commit/09c6f5fc69beb80b978d78aa375f92cb3e0c3f8c

If someone can point me in the right direction I would be happy to prepare these as proper contributions to the project.
We use github for the source repository, as you've figured simply by forking; so just submit as a pull request
